The campus safety is pretty good. There are places around the edge of campus that should be lit more, but on campus it's not bad and there are emergency buttons throughout.
There is Greek life here but it isn't a major thing that's as prominent as other colleges and universities.
There are multiple clubs and activities on campus. However, more awareness needs to be made for these things.
Clarion is great for students who don't want to be a big city and are focused more on getting a degree than getting drunk every night. Also, it is a great school for business students.
There is an apple on campus in which any one can write/spray paint on it.
The price of Clarion is definitely great, but the curriculum isn't too rigorous and the atmosphere on campus isn't overwhelmingly great either.
There is a mall with a movie theaters and a few stores. There are also activities and current movies being played every weekend.
The food here is pretty good and they try to have a variety of places/things to eat.

There are many places to live in Clarion. I live in the traditional dorms and they aren't too bad. They are a nice size and very clean. The cleaning staff is so nice as well as the CAs. The only downside is that the traditional dorms have community bathrooms, but that is going to change once they finish building the other ones. The campus also have suites and more apartment like living called Reinhard Village.
The academics are can be challenging at times. It just depends on the class and teacher.
Make sure that you visit the school before you attend.

Clarion University of Pennsylvania is small, rural school located in Clarion, PA. It provides opportunities for success, like internships and clubs. It has a diverse amount of degrees, specifically in business.
